isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Engine and Vehicle Features - Standard Features - Coolant Temperature Compensation (Engine Over Temperature Protection System)

svcproc.title: Coolant Temperature Compensation (Engine Over Temperature Protection System)
svcproc.para: Coolant temperature compensation reduces fuel delivery if the engine coolant temperature is above the cooling system specifications.

Before standard engine warning or optional warning/protection systems engage, the reduction in fuel delivery begins when the engine coolant temperature reaches approximately 107 °C (225 °F). A rapid reduction of 15 percent is achieved when engine coolant temperature reaches approximately 110 °C (230 °F).

note.para: Coolant temperature compensation is disabled in emergency vehicles that require 100 percent power on demand.
